intro: Stachytarpheta grandiflora, commonly known as the largeflower shrub or purpletop, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The flowers are typically violet or purple in color, with tubular corollas that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
